cbccore.create
Class Create

java.lang.Object
  cbccore.create.Create

public class Create
extends java.lang.Object

Allows high-level access the the create (vs. cbccore.low.Create)

See Also:
Create, CreateMovementPlugin, DriveTrain

connect

public void connect()
             throws CreateConnectException
First step for connecting CBC to Create. This function puts the Create in the safe mode.

Throws:
CreateConnectException
See Also:
disconnect()

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Returns the Create to proper state. Call this at the end of your program.

See Also:
connect()

start

public void start()
Puts the Create into passive mode (no motors).

See Also:
Create.Mode, setMode(cbccore.create.Create.Mode), getMode()

setMode

public void setMode(Create.Mode m)
Changes the Create's mode. Safe stops if it senses the drop sensor, Full will do everything ignoring safety triggers, even if it means destroying itself. o_O

Parameters:
m - Mode.Off, Mode.Passive, Mode.Safe, or Mode.Full
See Also:
Create.Mode, setMode(cbccore.create.Create.Mode)

The Create roams around until it sees an IR dock and then attempts to dock.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the drive wheels

drive

public void drive(int speed,
                  int radius)
Drives in an arc.

Parameters:
speed - range is 20-500mm/s
radius - radius in mm/s.

A radius of 32767 will drive the robot straight.

A radius of 1 will spin the robot CCW

A radius of -1 will spin the robot CW

Negative radii will be right turns, positive radii left turns

See Also:
driveStraight(int)

driveStraight

public void driveStraight(int speed)
Drives straight at speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s

spinCW

public void spinCW(int speed)
Spins CW with edge speed of speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
See Also:
spinCCW(int), spinBlock(int, int)

spinCCW

public void spinCCW(int speed)
Spins CCW with edge speed of speed in mm/s

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
See Also:
spinCW(int), spinBlock(int, int)

driveDirect

public void driveDirect(int r_speed,
                        int l_speed)
Specifies individual left and right speeds in mm/s

Parameters:
r_speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of right wheel.
l_speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of left wheel.
See Also:
drive(int, int)

spinBlock

public int spinBlock(int speed,
                     int angle)
This function blocks and does a pretty accurate spin. Note that the function will not return until the spin is complete CAUTION: requesting the robot to spin more than about 3600 degrees may never terminate

Parameters:
speed - 20-500mm/s. Speed of edge (wheels) of bot.
angle - Angle in degrees to turn before returning.

CAUTION: requesting the robot to spin more than about 3600 degrees may never terminate

Returns:
-1 if error
See Also:
spinCW(int), spinCCW(int)

advanceLed

public void advanceLed(boolean on)
Turn on/off the advance LED

Parameters:
on - 1 to turn on light and 0 to turn it off
See Also:
playLed(boolean), powerLed(int, int)

public void playLed(boolean on)
Turn on/off the play LED

Parameters:
on - 1 to turn on light and 0 to turn it off
See Also:
advanceLed(boolean), powerLed(int, int)

powerLed

public void powerLed(int color,
                     int brightness)
Control the color and the brightness of the power LED

Parameters:
color - 0 is red and 255 green
brightness - 0 is off and 255 is full brightness
See Also:
advanceLed(boolean), playLed(boolean)

digitalOutput

public void digitalOutput(int bits)
This function sets the three digital out put pins 20,7,19 where 20 is the high bit and 19 is the low. You probably don't care about this function.

Parameters:
bits - Should have a value 0 to 7.

getLowSideDrivers

public LowSideDrivers getLowSideDrivers()
Turns on and off the signal for the three low side drivers (128 = 100%). A 0 or 1 should be given for each of the drivers to turn them off or on. You probably don't care about this function.

Returns:
An instance of LowSideDrivers

loadSong

public void loadSong(int num)
This loads a song into the robot's memory. Song can be numbered 0 to 15. The first element in each row of the array should be the number of notes (1-16) the subsequent pairs of bytes should be tone and duration see the roomba SCI manual for note codes. User's program should load the song data into the array before calling this routine. Sets gc_song_array, an inaccessable variable. DO NOT USE THIS FUNCTION UNTIL THE ISSUE IS RESOLVED

Parameters:
num - Song can be numbered 0 to 15
See Also:
playSong(int)

playSong

public void playSong(int num)
See the roomba SCI manual for note codes. Uses gc_song_array, an inaccessable variable. DO NOT USE THIS FUNCTION UNTIL THE ISSUE IS RESOLVED

Parameters:
num - Song can be numbered 0 to 15
See Also:
loadSong(int)

moveMm

public void moveMm(int mmps,
                   int mm)
Moves the create a set number of mm at a set speed. You should probably be using the movement library.

Parameters:
mmps - The speed of the create in millimeters-per-second
mm - The number of mm for the create to move.
See Also:
turnDeg(int, int), DriveTrain, CreateMovementPlugin, DriveTrain.moveCm(double, double)

turnDeg

public void turnDeg(int speed,
                    int deg)
Moves the create a set number of degrees at a set speed. You should probably be using the movement library.

Parameters:
speed - The number of seconds to travel for. (shouldn't this be changed to degrees-per-sec to make range checking easier on the user?)
deg - The number of degrees for the create to turn.
See Also:
turnDeg(int, int), DriveTrain, CreateMovementPlugin, DriveTrain.rotateDegrees(double, double)
